creator.name: College van Commissarissen voor Kleine Zaken / Rechtbank voor Kleine Zaken Suriname
creator.name_english: Board of Commissioners for Minor Cases / Court of Justice for Minor Cases in Suriname
creator.his_func:
In their resolution of 10 July 1691, the Governor and the members of the Council of Policy and Criminal Justice established a Board of (six) Commissioners for the jurisdiction in minor cases up to a sum of five hundred pounds of sugar. Over the years, the jurisdiction was extended to districts outside Paramaribo, and the amounts for lawsuits were adjusted upwards to fl. 250 in 1815. From 1739 the number of sessions was four a year. To the competence of this college also belonged, from 1696 to 1773, the control of the common pasture in Paramaribo, enlarged with the maintenance of the streets and the quay and the planting of trees.
In 1828 the Board was replaced by a Court for Minor Cases. This Court sat in judgement on cases below 250 guilders. For cases above 100 guilders appeal to the (higher) Court of Justice was possible. In 1833 the Court of Justice for Minor Cases was replaced by a Committee of Justice for Minor Cases (1828-1863).
